wikipedia_page.main: William Purves (4 July 1888 – 18 September 1964) was a Scotland international rugby union player.

response: He was the brother of William Purves who was also capped for Scotland.

response: * William Purves (rugby union) (active 1912–1913), Scottish rugby union player

link_mentions.page: List of international rugby union families

response: Purves was born in Hill Place, Edinburgh, in 1842, the third son of a surgeon William Brown Purves (1799–1852) and his wife Margaret Purves (née Laidlaw) (1798–1855).Scotland Births and Baptisms, 1564–1950," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:XTRW-M3L : William Purves in entry for William Laidlaw Purves, 16 Apr 1842; citing Saint Cuthberts, Edinburgh, Midlothian, Scotland, reference – 2:18M6P16; By the time he was 13, both his parents had died and he was brought up by two spinster aunts, Jane and Euphemia Laidlaw. From this time, as a tribute to them and his mother he styled himself "Laidlaw Purves".
